Function Documentation

DWORD GetBadPackets ( DWORD  BioRadio150  ) 

Get the number of data packets received but found corrupted since starting acquisition.

Parameters:
BioRadio150 object handle
Returns:
number of bad packets, or no device object at handle (-1)

int GetBitErrCount ( DWORD  BioRadio150  ) 

Get total number of bit errors corrected by forward error correction (when processing data packets) since starting acquisition.

Parameters:
BioRadio150 object handle
Returns:
bit error count, or no device object at handle (-1)

int GetBitErrRate ( DWORD  BioRadio150  ) 

Get average rate of bit errors corrected by forward error correction over the last 10 radio packets.

Parameters:
BioRadio150 object handle
Returns:
bit error rate, or no device object at handle (-1)

int GetDownRSSI ( DWORD  BioRadio150  ) 

Get current Received Signal Strength Indicator (RSSI) as measured by Computer Unit when receiving transmission from User Unit.

Parameters:
BioRadio150 object handle
Returns:
downlink RSSI (range from 0 to 100), or no device object at handle (-1)

DWORD GetDroppedPackets ( DWORD  BioRadio150  ) 

Get the number of data packets lost or corrupted (and therefore padded for) since starting acquisition.

Parameters:
BioRadio150 object handle
Returns:
number of dropped packets, or no device object at handle (-1)

int GetFreqHoppingMode ( DWORD  BioRadio150  ) 

Indicates whether or not the BioRadio's radio is operating in Frequency-Hopping mode.

Parameters:
BioRadio150 object handle
Returns:
frequency hopping mode on (1), off (0), or error (-1)

int GetFreqHoppingModeIndicator (  ) 

Returns the integer value that GetRFChannel() will return if the device is operating in Frequency-Hopping mode.

Returns:
frequency hopping mode indicator (-3)

DWORD GetGoodPackets ( DWORD  BioRadio150  ) 

Get the number of valid data packets received since starting acquisition.

Parameters:
BioRadio150 object handle
Returns:
number of good packets, or no device object at handle (-1)

int GetLinkBufferSize ( DWORD  BioRadio150  ) 

Get number of radio packets (containing data packets) currently stored in User Unit, queued for transmission. The link buffer will increase in size if data is not being collected in a timely manner, whether purposely or due to transmission difficulty.

Parameters:
BioRadio150 object handle
Returns:
link buffer size, or no device object at handle (-1)

int GetRFChannel ( DWORD  BioRadio150  ) 

Returns the narrowband RF channel on which the BioRadio 150 is communicating, or, if device is in Frequency-Hopping mode, the frequency-hopping mode indicator, (see GetFreqHoppingModeIndicator().)

Parameters:
BioRadio150 object handle
Returns:
RF channel, frequency-hopping mode indicator, or error (-1)

int GetUpRSSI ( DWORD  BioRadio150  ) 

Get current Received Signal Strength Indicator (RSSI) as measured by User Unit when receiving transmission from Computer Unit.

Parameters:
BioRadio150 object handle
Returns:
uplink RSSI (range from 0 to 100), or no device object at handle (-1)

int GetUsableRFChannelList ( int *  UsableRFChannelList,
int  Size 
)

Populate the provided array with the list of possible narrowband RF channel values, (excluding frequency-hopping mode indicator), in increasing order.

Parameters:
UsableRFChannelList empty array to be filled with the valid RF channels
Size cardinality of the provided UsableRFChannelList array (100 suggested)
Returns:
number of usable channels filled in UsableRFChannelList

int SetFreqHoppingMode ( DWORD  BioRadio150,
bool  HoppingEnabled 
)

Enable Frequency-Hopping Mode, or disable and set to Narrowband Mode.

Parameters:
BioRadio150 object handle
HoppingEnabled enable (true) or disable (false) Frequency Hopping
Returns:
success (1) or failure (not 1)

int SetRFChannel ( DWORD  BioRadio150,
int  RFChannel 
)

Configure BioRadio to communicate on a particular narrowband channel, or to operate in Frequency-Hopping Mode, (see GetFreqHoppingModeIndicator().)

Parameters:
BioRadio150 object handle
RFChannel a valid narrowband channel number, or the frequency-hopping indicator
Returns:
success (1), or error (not 1), including: no device object at handle, improper channel supplied, or error setting channel or mode
